content:
• Tuesday, July 10, 2018

  • Fresh shots in trade war slam futures

    • The president has begun the process of slapping tariffs on another $200B of Chinese imports.
    • Among open markets, the Nikkei (NYSEARCA:EWJ) is lower by 1.4%. The yuan is down 0.6% vs. the greenback, as is the aussie.
    • S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) and Nasdaq 100 (NASDAQ:QQQ) futures are down 0.85%. DJIA (NYSEARCA:DIA) futures are off 1%.
    • Related ETFs: FXI, YINN, FXA, YANG, MCHI, GXC, CYB, FXP-OLD, PGJ, CN, TDF, CNY, CHN, CXSE, XPP, FCA, YAO, YXI, CROC, GCH, FXCH, JFC, KGRN, DAUD, FLCH, UAUD, WCHN
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 PM | 188 Comments
  • OCX

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (07/10/2018)

    • Top gainers OCX +53.5%. VSAR-OLD +9.7. OTC:LNNFF +3.7%. SESN +2.5%. TVIX +2.1%.
    • Top Losers VOXX -13.5%. ARQL -8.0%.  AIR -2.8%. OTCQB:AXIM -2.5%. JWN -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst Pharma +9%, Idera Pharma -6% as merger terminated

    • BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) +9.1% after-hours but Idera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDRA) -6.5% after BioCryst shareholders voted against a proposed merger of the two companies; a majority of IDRA stockholders voted in favor of the agreement.
    • "The BioCryst board and management team remain confident in BCX-7353 and our ability to execute on our plan and advance our programs," BCRX says in announcing the termination of the merger deal.
    • BCRX will reimburse IDRA for $6M in transaction-related expenses as a result of nixing the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 15 Comments
  • OCLR

    Oclaro shareholders approve acquisition by Lumentum

    • Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) shareholders have approved the acquisition by Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE) after a vote at today’s stockholders’ meeting.
    • Approximately 96.2% voted in favor of the merger, which represented about 65.6% of Oclaro’s outstanding common stock.   
    • The deal is still expected to close in 2H subject to regulatory approval. 
    • Oclaro shares are down 0.3% aftermarket to $9.01. 
    • Lumentum shares are down 0.9% to $56.78.    
    • Previously: FTC clears Lumentum's deal for Oclaro (April 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 6 Comments
  • SRE

    Sempra Energy to launch offerings of common stock, convertible preferreds

    • Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE) -2.5% after-hours on news it plans to launch concurrent public offerings of $1.1B of common shares in connection with the forward sale agreements and $500M of shares of mandatory convertible preferred stock.
    • SRE expects to grant the underwriters options to purchase an additional $165M of common shares and an additional $75M of shares of the convertible preferred stock.
    • SRE plans to use the proceeds from the offerings to repay outstanding commercial paper, to fund working capital and for other general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARQL

    ArQule readies stock offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) is down 7% after hours on the heels of its planned public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • NVS

    Pricing transparency law in California having effect, drug makers nix planned increases

    • Bloomberg reports that some drug firms have axed plans to increase pricing for certain products or have rolled back hikes in response to a new law in California aimed at pricing transparency. The law, requiring drug makers to give advance notice of significant price increases, is designed to pressure companies to keep prices down. It appears to be working.
    • In the past several weeks, Novartis (NYSE:NVS), Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD), Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) and Novo Nordisk (NYSE:NVO) have notified California health plans rolling back or reducing price hikes on at least 10 drugs.
    • Pharma companies are far from accepting the new reality, however. Its lobbying group, Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America, is challenging the law in court.
    • Selected tickers: XLV, IBB, IHE, XPH, PPH, VHT, PFE, AMGN, BIIB, VRTX, AGN, ABBV, LLY, GSK, AZN, JNJ, MRK, SHPG, VRX, TEVA
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 137 Comments
  • OZK

    Bank earnings may rise, but stocks aren't following

    • As analysts expect banks' Q2 earnings to provide good news when they start kicking in on Friday, their stocks aren't reflecting that optimism today--possibly due to concern over the flattening yield curve and trade tariff drama.
    • After three days of gains, the bank-heavy Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) is down 0.3%,while the S&P 500 Banks Industry Group Total Return Index dips 0.6%.
    • Regional banks, especially, seem a little more affected than the bigger banks. Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK -1.3%), Regions Financial (RF -1.1%), and Huntington Bancshares (HBAN -1.6%) all lost more than 1% in late trading.
    • Among the big banks, Citigroup (C -1.1%) was the weakest. Bank of America (BAC -0.8%) was the most active stock by volume in U.S. trading.
    • U.S. 10-year Treasury yield exceeds the 2-year yield by just 28 basis points compared with about 35 basis points about two weeks ago.
    • Previously: Banks climb for third day anticipating strong earnings (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 38 Comments
  • TPX

    Mattress stock weak after Wedbush warns

    • Tempur Sealy (TPX -8.8%) and Sleep Number (SNBR -3.4%) trade lower after Wedbush warns that the mattress sellers could fall short with their Q2 earnings reports.
    • Sleep Number is the first up to report numbers on July 25, while Tempur Sealy is expected to post results in early August.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • CMI

    Cummins upped to Buy at Stifel on 'stronger for longer' truck equipment view

    • Cummins (CMI +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel, which says shares of truck equipment companies have been under pressure primarily on concerns that the cycle is at a peak.
    • But Stifel analyst Michael Baudendistel holds a "stronger for longer" outlook on the truck equipment market, mainly due to robust freight rates, and he highlights CMI's potential to utilize its balance sheet to complete one or more transformative acquisitions.
    • But the firm cuts its CMI price target to $160 from $174, noting that the company's end markets are generally at higher than average points in their respective cycles.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • PHIO

    RXi Pharma breaks downtrend, up 23%

    • Thinly traded nano cap RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII +22.8%) is up on almost a 4x surge in volume. Shares had been in a downtrend since a brief rally in March, shedding 70% of their value since touching $6.76 on March 15.
    • This morning, collaboration partner BioAxone BioSciences announced that the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke awarded it a $1.1M grant to fund the continued development of BA-434 for the treatment of spinal cord injury. RXi will receive ~$119K of the award for its contribution.
    • On the capital front, RXi had $2.6M in cash at the end of March while operations consumed $1.9M during the quarter. In April, the company executed a stock offering that raised net proceeds of $4.1M. Operations consumed an average of $2.4M of cash per quarter in 2017 so more capital will be needed before year-end.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • SPYR

    SPYR signs LOI to acquire highly accretive online game

    • SPYR (OTCPK:SPYR +10%) has signed an asset purchase Letter of Intent (LOI) to acquire a popular massively multiplayer online role-playing game or MMORPG.
    • The target company currently generates more than $9M in annual revenue (unaudited information).
    • Upon closing of the transaction, SPYR will acquire all of the game assets, including the game’s experienced development team.
    • Mike Turner, SPYR’s VP of Strategic Partnerships states, “This highly accretive acquisition will result in SPYR generating meaningful pro forma revenue and cash flow".
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • MGIC

    Magic Software +5.8% on earning Microsoft Partner status

    • Magic Software (NASDAQ:MGIC) gains 5.8% to $8.68 after announcing it earned co-sell ready status through the Microsoft One Commercial Partner program.
    • The status applies to the Magic xpi integration platform and Magic xpc cloud-based iPaaS.       
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTSL

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (07/10/2018)

    • Gainers: MTSL +116%. BLIN +114%. BDR +20%. CLPS +16%. CASA +10%.
    • Losers: LEDS -19%. BBOX -15%. SPA -14%. BKTI -11%. RDVT -9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • GOOG

    Google launches a retail ad tool with Shopify

    • Google (GOOG +0.2%)(GOOGL +0.2%) is launching a new commerce tool to make it easier for retailers to run shopping ads.
    • The ads will appear on several Google services and marketers can purchase the spots through Google or Shopify (SHOP +0.2%).   
    • Retailers can set business goals for the ads, such as getting new customers or driving traffic, and that can help Google target the ads across search results, Maps, YouTube, and elsewhere on the web.   
    • The retail feature is one of four new ad products Google launched today. The suite also includes responsive search ads, which allows marketers to use more words and as many as 15 different headlines to pitch to customers. Google selects the best words/headlines based on frequently used search terms.      
    • Previously: Reuters: EU Android fine decision pushed back as Trump visits (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 17 Comments
  • GBR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (07/10/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +14%. EGY +13%. SAEX +13%. USAU +11%. MCEP +10%.
    • Losers: AMTX -9%. OTC:ANW -8%. GEVO -8%. ACET -7%. TANH -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • BTAI

    BioXcel at new high, up 14%

    • Relatively recent IPO BioXcel Therapeutics (BTAI +14.4%) has cleared resistance on modestly higher volume, albeit on turnover of only 56K shares, to reach its highest point since its U.S. debut on March 8.
    • Earlier today, the company announced the formation of a Clinical Advisory Board that will counsel management on lead candidate BXCL501 as it advances through clinical development for the treatment of agitation.
    • Previously: BioXcel Therapeutics prices IPO at $11 (March 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • SMPL

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (07/10/2018)

    • Gainers: SMPL +8%. CLPR +7%. CLDC +6%.
    • Losers: PPDF -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • BLIN

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/10/2018)

    • Gainers: BLIN +132%. MTSL +110%. INSP +22%. CLPS +18%. BTAI +18%. SAEX +17%. MNOV +12%. SMMT +12%. GBR +12%. DCAR +12%.
    • Losers: ISR -36%. STAF -33%. OTCPK:MBVX -26%. BIOC -22%. LEDS -21%. SPRO -19%. BBOX -15%. CVM -13%. SSC-OLD -12%. SPA -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • TNTR-OLD

    Tintri +15.3% on Chapter 11 filing

    • Tintri (NASDAQ:TNTR-OLD) announces filing for Chapter 11. The company will continue operating as a debtor-in-possession under the bankruptcy court’s jurisdiction.
    • Tintri confirms entering into a letter of intent with DataDirect Networks to purchase its assets. The letter is non-binding, and Tintri notes that any proceeds might not be enough to pay off its creditors. 
    • Tintri doesn’t expect stockholders to receive any return on their shares. 
    • Tintri shares are up 15.3% to $0.21.  
    • Previously: DataDirect Networks stages bid to acquire Tintri’s assets and expand its storage portfolio into the enterprise (July 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    BofAML raises Apple target on $8B AR potential

    • Augmented reality could be an $8B revenue opportunity for Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), according to Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
    • Analyst Wamsi Mohan says AR apps and increased iPhone sales due to the tech could create $6B to $8B in additional revenue within the next two years. Apps are expected to contribute $1B of the total. 
    • The analyst puts the revenue upside as high as $11B if Apple introduces AR-specific glasses. 
    • Firm reiterates its Buy rating and raises its Apple price target by $5 to $230, a 21% upside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Apple shares are up 0.3% to $191.12.       
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 25 Comments
  • FTSSF

    First Cobalt +15% after identifying second Kerr cobalt mineralization trend

    • First Cobalt (OTCQX:FTSSF +15.2%) jumps after saying drilling in the Canadian Cobalt Camp in Ontario identified a second cobalt mineralization trend within the Kerr area extending over a 500-meter strike length.
    • First Cobalt reports finding several mineralized intervals near the Drummond and Kerr Lake mines containing multiple closely spaced cobalt-silver veins.
    • President and CEO Trent Mell says the company is reallocating a larger portion of its 2018 exploration budget to the Kerr area despite having many prospective targets; results from nine drill holes are pending and additional drilling is planned.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 8 Comments
  • BOX

    Box acquires intelligent search company Butter.ai

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) acquires cloud-based intelligent search company Butter.ai for undisclosed terms.
    • The Butter.ai team will join Box and help bring more intelligence to the search capabilities within the Box product. 
    • Evernote veterans founded Butter.ai, which until now worked as a search assistant inside Slack. 
    • The startup raised $3.3M in two seed rounds with participation from Slack and General Catalyst. 
    • Box shares are down 0.3% to $26.52.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • BA

    Boeing beats Airbus with 460 net first-half orders

    • Boeing (BA +1.5%) says it recorded 460 net aircraft orders after cancellations in the six months through June, well ahead of rival Airbus' (OTCPK:EADSF, OTCPK:EADSY) 206 during the same period.
    • H1 deliveries rose 7.4% Y/Y to 378 commercial aircraft, led by strong demand for its single-aisle 737 jetliners, while total Q2 deliveries gained 6% Y/Y to 194.
    • Last week, Airbus said it delivered 303 aircraft during H1, 1% lower than the prior-year period.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 7 Comments
  • FCAU

    Cristiano Ronaldo implications in Italy

    • The transfer of Real Madrid soccer superstar Cristiano Ronaldo to Juventus is official, reports Bloomberg.
    • The signing of Ronaldo is creating some headaches for Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (NYSE:FCAU) in Italy due to the company's willingness to help finance the €100M deal. The common link between Fiat and the soccer club is the Agnelli family which owns 29%  of Fiat and 64% of Juventus. A few social media campaigns against Fiat on the behalf of workers have already started.
    • Shares of Juventus Football Club (OTCPK:JVTSF) gained another 5.54% in Milan today and are up more than 30% since the Ronaldo pursuit began to heat up. Some European analysts think the rally was too much, too soon.
    • There is also some speculation that Ronaldo playing in Italy could lead to a sponsorship deal with Ferrari (NYSE:RACE).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 13 Comments
  • THST

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (07/10/2018)

    • Gainers: THST +13%. KOSS +8%. JRSH +7%. VNCE +5%.
    • Losers: SEED -10%. PRPL -7%. DOGZ -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • GRIF

    More on Griffin Industrial Realty's Q2 results

    • Griffin Industrial Realty (NASDAQ:GRIF) reported Q2 revenue decrease of 49.8% Y/Y to $9.09M, reflecting a decrease in revenue from property sales partially offset by an increase in rental revenue.
    • Segment revenue: Rental $8.19M (+11.7% Y/Y) and property sales $0.89M (-91.6% Y/Y), property sales occur periodically, and year to year changes in revenue and gains from property sales may not be indicative of any trends in the company’s real estate business.
    • Q2 Operating margin declined by 2,705 bps to 20.9%.
    • G&A expenses were $1.84M (-15.24% Y/Y), decrease reflects write-off of costs related to a land purchase that was not completed in the 2Q17.
    • Profit from leasing activities was $5.78M (+12.7% Y/Y).
    • Rental portfolio has 35 buildings with ~3.17M sq ft. which is 94% leased as of May 31, 2018.
    • Previously: Griffin Industrial Realty reports Q2 results (July 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • DLB

    Dolby Labs appoints Samsung vet as CMO

    • Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB) appoints Todd Pendleton as SVP and CMO.
    • Pendleton spent 15 years at Nike in marketing and was CMO of Samsung North America.   
    • Dolby shares are up 0.7% to $62.89.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ARCB

    Wolfe Research check in on logistics sector ahead of Q2 earnings

    • Wolfe Research updates on trends in the logistics sector.
    • "Freight volumes in 2Q remained very strong and pricing trends are accelerating, so we have high expectations for 2Q reports and expect many more beats than misses this quarter," writes analyst Scott Group.
    • As it looks to Q2 earnings reports, Wolfe is most above consensus on ArcBest (ARCB -0.9%), Heartland Express (HTLD -0.9%), YRC Worldwide (YRCW -0.6%) and Hub Group (HUBG -0.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • AABA

    Susquehanna to Altaba: Cut bait on Yahoo Japan, focus on Alibaba

    • Fresh off a three-way deal that sees Altaba (NASDAQ:AABA) selling about a third of its stake in Yahoo Japan (OTCPK:YAHOY), Susquehanna urges Altaba to sell the rest and focus on monetizing its share of Alibaba (NYSE:BABA).
    • The Yahoo Japan portion has gone poorly for Altaba, which is selling at a multi-year low, and it's time for "cutting bait" and focusing on a deal with Alibaba, writes analyst Joseph Stauff. There's upside of $8-$12/share in an Alibaba transaction against $2/share in downside. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Yahoo Japan's buyback is being facilitated by major shareholder SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY), which is buying Yahoo Japan shares from Altaba before selling them back to Yahoo Japan.
    • In U.S. trading today: OTCPK:YAHOY +5.3%; AABA +1%; BABA +0.4%; OTCPK:SFTBY +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 7 Comments
  • RGNX

    REGENXBIO adds to up move, shares ahead 3%

    • REGENXBIO (RGNX +2.9%) is up on below-average volume. Shares have more than tripled since early April when Novartis announced its $8.7B takeout of AveXis. Money flow into gene therapy stocks has ramped up since then as investors expect more M&A activity in the space.
    • Chardan analyst Gbola Amusa is along for the ride, raising his price target to $130 (55% upside) citing the company's leadership in AAV-based gene therapy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • BAK

    Report: LyondellBasell, Odebrecht to seal Braskem deal by mid-October

    • Odebrecht is set to agree on the sale of its controlling stake in petrochemical company Braskem (BAK +3.8%) to LyondellBasell Industries (LYB +0.3%) by the middle of October, Brazilian newspaper Valor Econômico reports.
    • Petrobras (PBR -0.1%) will decide by theb whether to include its own stake in BAK in the deal, clearing the way for the transaction to be submitted to regulators, according to the report.
    • Odebrecht currently owns 50.1% of BAK's voting capital, while PBR holds 47%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTSL

    MER Telemanagement +163%, among Nasdaq top gainers

    • Israeli nanocap firm MER Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) is up 163% today, with Nasdaq volume spiking to 40 times normal after just a few hours of trading.
    • It's not clear what the catalyst for the big move is, if any. The company recently submitted a plan to Nasdaq to regain compliance with a listing rule calling for minimum stockholders' equity of $2.5M.
    • That plan calls for cost-cutting measures, including reducing personnel, along with an institutional investor putting in $1.5M in return for issuance of a new class of convertible preferred stock.
    • Short interest had apparently increased over recent weeks to over 100,000 shares from about 80,000 shares short in the middle of June.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • CERN

    Cerner -4.4% on Evercore downgrade

    • Evercore ISI downgrades Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN) from Inline to Underperform.
    • Price target drops from $57 to $55, a nearly 14% downside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Cerner shares are down 4.4% to $60.88.       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCX

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (07/10/2018)

    • Gainers: OCX +21%. MNOV +20%. INSP +20%. CTXR +15%. SMMT +15%.
    • Losers: ISR -36%. OTCPK:MBVX -23%. SPRO -19%. CVM -16%. BIOC -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • HCA

    Hospital operators in the green

    • Hospital operators are all in the green this morning. Leaders HCA (HCA +0.3%) and Humana (HUM +0.5%) kick off earnings season with their Q2 reports on July 25 and August 1, respectively.
    • Related tickers: (UHS +1.2%)(SGRY +1.9%)(SSY +2.9%)(SEM +1.1%)(QHC +1.2%)(HLTH +2.1%)(LPNT +0.6%)(THC +1.8%)(CYH +0.8%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell -7.5% as UBS cuts outlook on HT purchase

    • Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB) has slid 7.5% amid a UBS downgrade to Neutral on concerns about the company's recently closed acquisition of Hawaiian Telcom.
    • In the near term, capital allocation is likely to focus on investment and deleveraging rather than shareholder returns, analyst Batya Levi writes. As for the longer term, Hawaiian Telcom results imply a lower contribution than expected. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • UBS reduces its price target to $18 from $22; shares are down to $16 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • KDP

    Time to talk about Keurig Dr Pepper

    • Keurig Dr Pepper (NYSE:KDP) opened for trading at $20.50 today and then bubbled up to as high as $21.08 before settling back to $20.91.
    • There's already some buzz over what moves the new beverage company will pull off as it integrates complentary businesses. Wells Fargo analyst Bonnie Herzog sees a sale of the company's Body Armour stake to Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) as a possibility.
    • "We don't think the new Keurig Dr. Pepper management team is interested in maintaining minority stakes (such as those Dr. Pepper undertook with its allied brands)," writes Herzog. "As such, we think there's a good chance BODYARMOR could seek out a new partner/owner and we think Coca-Cola would be very interested in the brand given its success (with BODYARMOR's retail sales over the last 52-weeks of $263 million in the Sports Drink category per Nielsen, up 84% y/y). We think Coca-Cola would position BODYARMOR as a premium, isotonic brand above Powerade," she adds.
    • Investors have a bit of a clean slate on Keurig Dr Pepper on day one of trading as investment firms aren't on record yet with their ratings and subsequent defenses.
    • Previously: Meet Keurig Dr Pepper (July 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 46 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen gives up more BAN2401-stoked gain, down 4%

    • Profit-taking in Biogen (BIIB -3.7%) continues on average volume. Shares have retraced more than 7% since touching $367.89 on July 6, although still up 14% since July 5.
    • Buying surged after the company reported positive 18-month data from a mid-stage study of BAN2401 in patients with early Alzheimer's disease, the same study that failed to demonstrate a treatment effect at month 12.
    • Baird's Brian Skorney is the latest analyst to question the robustness of the data. He downgraded the stock to Neutral with a $323 (5% downside risk) price target citing the ambiguous nature of the results. He wants to see specific data that support the relationship between drug-induced reductions in amyloid with slowing clinical progression, adding that ADCOMS is not an externally validated endpoint and "we haven't seen any standard cognitive measures yet."
    • Previously: Leerink's Porges not on board with Biogen's positive trial results for Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401 (July 6)
    • Previously: Biogen +6% after Alzheimer's drug succeeds in trial (July 5)
    • Previously: Biogen's Alzheimer's candidate BAN2401 flunks mid-stage study (Dec. 21, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • TLP

    ArcLight offers to buy TransMontaigne Partners for $38/share

    • Transmontaigne Partners (TLP +3.8%) shoots higher after ArcLight Energy Partners offers to acquire the company for $38/share in cash.
    • TLP cautions that a definitive agreement would be subject to various contingencies including the approval of TLP's conflicts committee, the general partner and a majority of unitholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 21 Comments
  • TEUM

    Pareteum expects Q2 revenue of at least $5.75M

    • Pareteum (TEUM -2%) expects to report Q2 revenues of at least $5.75M (+78% Y/Y) vs. a consensus of $4.75M.
    • Connections rose to ~2,713,600 (+225% Y/Y) as of June 30, 2018.
    • The company raised revenue outlook to 80% (Y/Y) for 2018.
    • Pareteum's Q2 earnings and results update call is expected to be held during the week of Aug. 6, 2018.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • OCDGF

    Ocado Group up 3% post H1 results

    • Ocado Group (OTCPK:OCDGF +3.2%) reported H1 revenue growth of 12.1% Y/Y to £799.99M reflecting increase in the average number of orders per week and fees earned from clients.
    • Overall gross margin declined by 50 bps to 34.23%, operating margin declined by 202 bps to -0.35% and EBITDA margin declined by 147 bps to 4.9%.
    • Retail Segment results: Revenue £736.6M (+11.7% Y/Y) with orders per week of 291K (+11.9% Y/Y) and average order size of £108.18 (-0.2% Y/Y); gross margin declined by 76 bps to 28.6% and EBITDA margin declined by 68 bps to 6.25.
    • Solutions Segment results: Revenue £63.3M (+16.8% Y/Y) and EBITDA margin declined by 390 bps to -3.16%.
    • Active customers were 679K an increase of 12.8% Y/Y.
    • Company had cash and equivalents of £447.6M at the end of H1.
    • Company signed three international partnerships with with Sobeys, ICA and Kroger to develop the Ocado Smart Platform in Canada, Sweden and the United States respectively.
    • FY18 Outlook: Retail business revenue growth between 10-15% and Capex ~£210M.
    • Previously: Ocado Group reports 1H results (July 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • FORM

    B. Riley: FormFactor nearing growth objectives, near-term DRAM cloudy

    • B. Riley comments on FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM) following a meeting with management and sees long-term EPS of over $1.50 as a possibility in the next few years.
    • The firm sees two issues clouding near-term visibility: a Korean customer’s 1Y DRAM ramp and Intel’s unexpected CEO transition, which clouds the outlook for the next 14nm architecture refresh and potentially 10nm ramp timing.       
    • But B. Riley says these are now well known and advises investors to look for a FormFactor position on any market or post-results volatility. Valuation is 12.4x and 9.2x CY18 and CY19 EPS.
    • Price target: $19. 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • FormFactor shares are down 5.8% to $13.90.

    • Endeavour Silver (EXK -2.4%) releases Q2 production results for its three Mexican mines, showing an uptick in both silver and gold production.

  • ANCUF

    Alimentation Couche-Tard up 9.2% post Q4 results

    • Alimentation Couche-Tard (OTCPK:ANCUF +9.2%) reports Q4 revenue growth of 41.5% Y/Y to $13.6B.
    • Total merchandise and service revenues of $3.2B (+25% Y/Y), Same-store merchandise revenues increased by 1.8% in the U.S., 4.3% in Europe and by 3.6% in Canada.
    • Since the acquisition, CST sites same-store merchandise revenues grew both in the U.S and in Canada.
    • Merchandise and service gross margin increased 30 bps in the U.S. to 33.6%, it remained stable in Europe at 44% and, in Canada, it decreased 30 bps to 34.4%.
    • Total road transportation fuel volumes grew by 33.8%; Same-store road transportation fuel volumes decreased by 0.1% in the U.S. and by 2.9% in Canada, while same-store volumes increased by 0.1% in Europe.
    • Current annual synergies run rate related to the CST integration reached ~$153M.
    • Adjusted leverage ratio improved to 3.13:1.
    • Road transportation fuel gross margin increased by US 1.82¢ per gallon in the U.S. to US 17.29¢ per gallon, by US 0.89¢ per litre in Europe, to US 8.72¢ per litre and by CA 1.39¢ per litre in Canada, to CA 9.44¢ per litre.
    • Increase of CA 1¢ of the quarterly dividend, a growth of 11.1%.
    • Previously: Alimentation Couche-Tard reports Q4 results (July 9)

  • VVUS

    Vivus up 15% premarket on positive data for PAH candidate VI-0106

    • Nano cap Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) is up 15% premarket on increased volume on the heels of its announcement of positive data from a Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating VI-0106 in healthy volunteers.
    • The company says the results show that once-daily dosing may facilitate of the low tacrolimus concentrations needed for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) with minimal monitoring of drug levels.
    • Per the ongoing COMPERA registry study, the five-year survival rate for high-risk PAH patients is 22.8%. Also, data from three class 3/4 patients treated with VI-0106 under compassionate use status showed dramatically reduced hospitalization rates and improvements in functional class.
    • VI-0106 is a soft capsule formulation of tacrolimus (topical formulation is used to treat atopic dermatitis) being developed to treat PAH. The company plans to request Fast Track and Breakthrough Therapy designations in the U.S. for the indication in conjunction with its planned 505(b)(2) marketing application which allows the inclusion of data generated by others.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
